title: Is it right to say 'she's the most hot' or 'she's the hottest'? - Quora

response.answer_text: About a century ago the first phrase would have been considered proper grammar and I believe in England it still is but in America there has been a conscious effort to minimize descriptives to get right to the point. Therefore the word “most’ is rarely in used in favor of the ‘est’ adjective. Most Smart — smartest — but does not work with ‘intelligent’ because ‘intelligentest’ is just wrong and ‘most intelligent’ works. Most Pretty — Prettiest. But when we look at the word “bitch”, “most bitch” does not sound right but “most bitchy” does — yet “bitchiest” is short and to the point, and “most” preferred. (see…not preferrest).

You can use all three forms of the verb Hot Hotter Hottest depending upon the situation. If you simply want to compliment her,not comparing with anyone just say You are hot. And if you are comparing her with another girl Say , you are hotter. And if you wish to please her and want to say that she is outstanding just comparing with more than one, then say, You are the hottest. Much ,more ,most are not used here because verb form exist for hot.
